sen.j: 北丹鉄道（ほくたんてつどう）は、京都府福知山市の福知山駅から北へ河守駅までの路線を運営していた鉄道事業者である。
sen.e: Hokutan Railway is a railway operator which operated a line running northward from the Fukuchiyama Station in Fukichiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture to the Komori Station.
Hokutan Railway is a railway operator which operated a line running northward from the Fukuchiyama Station in Fukichiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture to Komori Station.
Hokutan Railway is a railway operator which operated a line running northward from the Fukuchiyama Station in Fukichiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture to Komori Station.

sen.j: 1968年（昭和43年）当時。
sen.e: At the time of 1968
At the time of 1968
At the time of 1968

sen.j: 社名：北丹鉄道株式会社
sen.e: Company name : Hokutan Railway Co., Ltd.
Company name : Hokutan Railway Co., Ltd.
Company name : Hokutan Railway Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 本社所在地：京都府福知山市（福知山西駅構内）
sen.e: Location of head office : Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture (inside the Fukuchiyama-nishi Station)
Location of head office : Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture (inside the Fukuchiyama-nishi Station)
Location of head office : Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture (inside the Fukuchiyama-nishi Station)

sen.j: 設立：1920年（大正9年）2月1日 設立時は「北丹軽便鉄道株式会社」
sen.e: Establishment : February 1, 1920. At the time of establishment, the company name was "Hokutan Keiben Railway Co., Ltd.".
Establishment : February 1, 1920. At the time of establishment, the company name was "Hokutan Keiben Railway Co., Ltd.".
Establishment : February 1, 1920. At the time of establishment, the company name was 'Hokutan Keiben Railway Co., Ltd..'

sen.j: 事業内容：地方鉄道事業 道路運送事業他
sen.e: Business : Local railway business, Road transportation business
Business : Local railway business, Road transportation business
Business : Local railway business, Road transportation business

sen.j: 資本金：1,500千円
sen.e: Capital : 1.5 M\
Capital : 1.5 M\
Capital : 1.5 M\

sen.j: 従業員数：43名（鉄道部門24名）
sen.e: Number of employees : 43 (railway division 24)
Number of employees : 43 (railway division 24)
Number of employees : 43 (railway division 24)

sen.j: 主要株主：不明
sen.e: Principal shareholders : Unknown
Principal shareholders : Unknown
Principal shareholders : Unknown

sen.j: 京都府北部、福知山市の福知山駅から加佐郡大江町 (京都府)（現在は福知山市の一部）の河守駅（現在の北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線大江駅 (京都府)近傍）までを由良川沿いに結ぶ鉄道を運営していた。
sen.e: The company operated a railway line that ran along the Yura River from the Fukuchiyama Station located in Fukuchiyama City, the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture, to the Komori Station (near the Oe Station (Kyoto Prefecture) of Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyafuku Line operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway) located in Oe-cho, Kasa-gun (Kyoto Prefecture) (a part of Fukuchiyama City at present).

The company operated a railway line that ran along the Yura River from the Fukuchiyama Station located in Fukuchiyama City, the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture, to the Komori Station (near the Oe Station (Kyoto Prefecture) of Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyafuku Line operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway) located in Oe-cho, Kasa-gun (Kyoto Prefecture) (a part of Fukuchiyama City at present).

The company operated a railway line that ran along the Yura River from the Fukuchiyama Station located in Fukuchiyama City, the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture, to the Komori Station (near the Oe Station (Kyoto Prefecture) of Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyafuku Line operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway) located in Oe Town, Kasa County (Kyoto Prefecture) (a part of Fukuchiyama City at present).
sen.cmt: choをtownに、gunをCountyに変更しました。

sen.j: 1923年（大正12年）9月22日開業。
sen.e: It started business on September 22, 1923.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It started business on September 22, 1923.
It started business on September 22, 1923.

sen.j: 設立当時は、北丹軽便鉄道株式会社という名称だったが開業前に改称している。
sen.e: The company name was Hokutan Keiben Railway Co., Ltd. when it was established, but it renamed when it started business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The company name was Hokutan Keiben Railway Co., Ltd. when it was established, but it was renamed when it started business.
The company name was Hokutan Keiben Railway Co., Ltd. when it was established, but it was renamed when it started business.

sen.j: 本来は福知山駅から北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線を短絡する目的があったが、宮津線の由良川架橋点が当初の予定より河口近くに変更されたため、河守駅から先の建設は断念した。
sen.e: The company initially intended to shorten the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line from the Fukuchiyama Station, but it gave up to construct the line beyond the Komori Station because the point of Miyazu Line's railway bridge was shifted toward the mouth of Yura river compared to the original plan.

The company initially intended to shorten the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line from the Fukuchiyama Station, but it gave up to construct the line beyond the Komori Station because the point of the Miyazu Line's railway bridge was shifted towards the mouth of Yura river compared to the original plan.

The company initially intended to shorten the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line from the Fukuchiyama Station, but it gave up to construct the line beyond the Komori Station because the point of the Miyazu Line's railway bridge was shifted towards the mouth of Yura river compared to the original plan.

sen.j: その後、日本鉄道建設公団が宮津駅から河守駅までを結ぶ路線を宮守線として建設することになり、1966年（昭和41年）に着工された。
sen.e: Thereafter, Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation decided to construct a line connecting the Miyazu Station and Komori Station as the Miyamori Line, and its construction work began in 1966.
Thereafter, Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation decided to construct a line connecting Miyazu Station and Komori Station as the Miyamori Line, and construction work began in 1966.
Thereafter, Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation decided to construct a line connecting Miyazu Station and Komori Station as the Miyamori Line, and construction work began in 1966.

sen.j: ルートは大江山をトンネルで抜け宮津 - 河守をほぼ直線的に結ぶものに変更されている。
sen.e: The line's route was changed into the one that connects Miyazu and Komori almost linearly by constructing a tunnel piercing Mt. Oe.
The line's route was changed into the one that connects Miyazu and Komori almost linearly by constructing a tunnel piercing Mt. Oe.
The line's route was changed into the one that connects Miyazu and Komori almost linearly by constructing a tunnel piercing Mt. Oe.

sen.j: しかし、1969年（昭和44年）に沿線の河守鉱山が閉山したことによって北丹鉄道の貨物輸送は激減し、経営が成り立たなくなる。
sen.e: However, when Komori Mine located along the line was closed in 1969, Hokutan Railway's freight service volume decreased sharply and the company faced difficulty in continuing business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, when Komori Mine located along the line was closed in 1969, Hokutan Railway's freight service volume decreased sharply and the company faced difficulty in continuing business.
However, when Komori Mine located along the line was closed in 1969, Hokutan Railway's freight service volume decreased sharply and the company faced difficulty in continuing business.

sen.j: このため、宮守線を待つことなく1971年（昭和46年）3月2日に由良川治水事業を名目に運行休止、程なくバス事業も営業休止に追い込まれた。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, the company suspended its railway operation on March 2, 1971, before the completion of the Miyamori Line, in the name of flood control projects of Yura River, and it also suspended its bus operation soon after.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Under such circumstances, the company suspended its railway operation on March 2, 1971, before the completion of the Miyamori Line, in the name of flood control projects of Yura River, and it also suspended its bus operation soon after.

Under such circumstances, the company suspended its railway operation on March 2, 1971, before the completion of the Miyamori Line, in the name of flood control projects of Yura River, and it also suspended its bus operation soon after.

sen.j: 1974年（昭和49年）に鉄道路線が正式に廃止されるとともに会社は解散、バス事業については京都交通 (亀岡)株式会社に譲渡している。
sen.e: The company was dissolved in 1974 when its railway line was formally abolished, and it assigned its bus business to Kyoto Kotsu Co., Ltd (Kameoka).
The company was dissolved in 1974 when its railway line was formally abolished, and it assigned its bus business to Kyoto Kotsu Co., Ltd (Kameoka).
The company was dissolved in 1974 when its railway line was formally abolished, and it assigned its bus business to Kyoto Kotsu Co., Ltd (Kameoka).

sen.j: 北丹鉄道の廃止によって盲腸線と化す可能性のあった宮守線は、1975年（昭和50年）に河守（大江） - 福知山間が建設予定線として追加され宮福線と改称、1979年（昭和54年）にこの区間についても着工された。
sen.e: The Miyamori Line, which could have become useless after the abolition of Hokutan Railway, was renamed the Miyafuku Line in 1975 when Komori (Oe) - Fukuchiyama section was added to its construction plan, and the construction work of this section started in 1979.

The Miyamori Line, which could have become useless after the abolition of Hokutan Railway, was renamed the Miyafuku Line in 1975 when Komori (Oe) - Fukuchiyama section was added to its construction plan, and the construction work of this section started in 1979.

The Miyamori Line, which could have become useless after the abolition of Hokutan Railway, was renamed the Miyafuku Line in 1975 when Komori (Oe) - Fukuchiyama section was added to its construction plan, and the construction work of this section started in 1979.

sen.j: なお、北丹鉄道が望んでいた鉄道路盤の国による買い上げは由良川治水事業により建設ルートが変更されたため実現しなかった。
sen.e: Hokutan Railway wanted the nation to purchase the roadbed, but it was not realized because the construction route of the Miyafuku Line was altered due to flood control projects of Yura River.
Hokutan Railway wanted the nation to purchase the roadbed, but it was not realized because the construction route of the Miyafuku Line was altered due to flood control projects of Yura River.
Hokutan Railway wanted the nation to purchase the roadbed, but it was not realized because the construction route of the Miyafuku Line was altered due to flood control projects of Yura River.

sen.j: 宮守線の建設工事は1980年（昭和55年）の日本国有鉄道経営再建促進特別措置法施行により中断するものの、第三セクターに引き継がれた。
sen.e: The construction work of the Miyamori Line was suspended when Japan National Railway Reform Act was enacted in 1980, but it was taken over by a joint public-private company.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The construction work of the Miyamori Line was suspended when the Japan National Railway Reform Act was enacted in 1980, but it was taken over by a joint public-private company.
The construction work of the Miyamori Line was suspended when the Japan National Railway Reform Act was enacted in 1980, but it was taken over by a joint public-private company.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）に宮福鉄道（現在の北近畿タンゴ鉄道）宮福線として開業している。
sen.e: The line commenced operation in 1988 as the Miyafuku Railway (Current Kitakinki Tango Railway) Miyafuku Line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The line commenced operation in 1988 as the Miyafuku Railway (Current Kitakinki Tango Railway) Miyafuku Line.
The line commenced operation in 1988 as the Miyafuku Railway (Current Kitakinki Tango Railway) Miyafuku Line.

sen.j: 路線の多くは由良川沿いに敷設されていたが、建設資金の乏しさから河川敷を線路用地に使っていた。
sen.e: While the line was constructed along the Yura River, its track was laid on the riverbed due to the shortage of construction fund.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: While the line was constructed along the Yura River, its track was laid on the riverbed due to the shortage of construction funds.
While the line was constructed along the Yura River, its track was laid on the riverbed due to the shortage of construction funds.

sen.j: そのため由良川に多発した水害の被害を度々受けた。
sen.e: As a result, the line was frequently damaged by the flood of Yura River.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As a result, the line was frequently damaged by the flood of Yura River.
As a result, the line was frequently damaged by the flood of Yura River.

sen.j: 元々輸送量が少なかったこともあって廃止まで常に経営難が続いており、保守整備が行えないため線路状態は著しく荒廃していた。
sen.e: As the company was always in financial difficulties until its dissolution because of chronic small traffic volume, it couldn't afford to conduct the maintenance work properly and as a result, the track was devastated.

As the company was always in financial difficulties until its dissolution because of chronic small traffic volume, it couldn't afford to conduct the maintenance work properly and as a result, the track was devastated.

As the company was always in financial difficulties until its dissolution because of chronic small traffic volume, it couldn't afford to conduct the maintenance work properly and as a result, the track was devastated.

sen.j: 当鉄道の曲線区間はレールが円弧ではなく、マッチ棒を並べて円を描いたように角張った特異な線形だった。
sen.e: The shape of the line's curve section was not circular but angulate, something like a curve drawn by lining up matchsticks.
The shape of the line's curve section was not circular but angulate, something like a curve drawn by lining up matchsticks.
The shape of the line's curve section was not circular but angulate, something like a curve drawn by lining up matchsticks.

sen.j: 犬釘が軌条を固定できないためであった。
sen.e: The reason of the above was that spikes couldn't fix the track.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The reason for the above was that spikes couldn't fix the track.
The reason for the above was that spikes couldn't fix the track.

sen.j: 水害でバラスト（砂利）が流失した後に泥が詰まり枕木が腐っていたのがその原因であった。
sen.e: The cause of such situation was that railroad ties were corroded by mud that was piled up after ballast was washed away by a flood.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The cause of such situation was that railroad ties were corroded by mud that was piled up after ballast was washed away by a flood.
The cause of such situation was that railroad ties were corroded by mud that was piled up after ballast was washed away by a flood.

sen.j: もともとカーブを構成するレール一本一本は真っ直ぐなので釘が外れれば元に戻り、カーブ全体が角張った形に変形してしまった。
sen.e: As each piece of rail that makes up a curve is straight, a curve became angulate shape after spikes were removed.
As each piece of rail that makes up a curve is straight, a curve became an angulate shape after spikes were removed.
As each piece of rail that makes up a curve is straight, a curve became an angulated shape after spikes were removed.

sen.j: それでも枕木交換できず、犬釘の横に小釘を打ってせめてもの補強すら試みられた。
sen.e: The company couldn't afford to replace railroad ties even under such situation, and tried to reinforce by driving small nails beside spikes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The company couldn't afford to replace railroad ties even under such a situation, and tried to reinforce by driving small nails beside spikes.
The company couldn't afford to replace railroad ties even under such a situation, and tried to reinforce by driving small nails beside spikes.

sen.j: またレールが固定されないため線路間隔がずれて列車が脱線することもあった。
sen.e: Further, the gauge became uneven because the track was not fixed, and trains sometimes went off the track.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Further, the gauge became uneven because the track was not fixed, and trains sometimes went off the track.
Further, the gauge became uneven because the track was not fixed, and trains sometimes went off the track.

sen.j: こうした線路状態のため最高速度はわずか25km/hに制限されていた。
sen.e: Because of such track conditions, maximum speed was limited to only 25 km/h.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Because of such track conditions, maximum speed was limited to only 25 km/h.
Because of such track conditions, maximum speed was limited to only 25 km/h.

sen.j: 客車の老朽化もひどく、古い車両ではこの低速ですら振動で室内全体が歪むという状態であった。
sen.e: As passenger cars were also aging, some old cars were warped by vibration even when they were running at such low speed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As passenger cars were also aging, some old cars were warped by vibration even when they were running at such low speed.
As passenger cars were also aging, some old cars were warped by vibration even when they were running at such low speed.

sen.j: 極端な低速運行のため、福知山－河守間12.4kmに45-52分を要した（かつて33分程度で結んでいた時期もあった）。
sen.e: It took 45 to 52 minutes for 12.4 km between Fukuchiyama and Komori (it took about 33 minutes at a time in the past).
It took 45 to 52 minutes for 12.4 km between Fukuchiyama and Komori (it took about 33 minutes at one time in the past).
It took 45 to 52 minutes for 12.4 km between Fukuchiyama and Komori (it took about 33 minutes at one time in the past).

sen.j: 乗客減も進み、荒廃してとうに末期症状を呈していた北丹鉄道がそれでも運行を続けたのは、将来の宮守線との接続および国による買い上げを目論んでのことであった。
sen.e: The reason why Hokutan Railway, which was then in desperate situation with the numbers of passengers continuously decreasing, continued its operation was that it expected the line's connection with the Miyamori Line as well as the purchase by the nation.

The reason why Hokutan Railway, which was then in a desperate situation with the numbers of passengers continuously decreasing, continued its operation was that it expected the line's connection with the Miyamori Line as well as the purchase by the nation.

The reason why Hokutan Railway, which was then in a desperate situation with the numbers of passengers continuously decreasing, continued its operation was that it expected the line's connection with the Miyamori Line as well as the purchase by the nation.

sen.j: なお2009年現在の宮福線福知山 - 大江の所要時間は特急電車で最短12分、各駅停車（途中5駅停車）の気動車で20分程度である。
sen.e: As of 2009, required time between Fukuchiyama and Kawamori of the Miyafuku Line is 12 minutes at the shortest by a limited express electric train and 20 minutes by a local diesel car (stop at five stations).

As of 2009, the required time between Fukuchiyama and Kawamori of the Miyafuku Line is 12 minutes at the shortest by a limited express electric train and 20 minutes by a local diesel car (stops at five stations).

As of 2009, the required time between Fukuchiyama and Kawamori of the Miyafuku Line is 12 minutes at the shortest by a limited express electric train and 20 minutes by a local diesel car (stops at five stations).

sen.j: 1919年（大正8年） 路線免許交付
sen.e: 1919 : License for the line was granted.
1919 : License for the line was granted.
1919 : License for the line was granted.

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年） 当初の北丹軽便鉄道から北丹鉄道に社名変更
sen.e: 1921 : Company name was changed from the original name Hokutan Keiben Railway to Hokutan Railway.
1921 : Company name was changed from the original name Hokutan Keiben Railway to Hokutan Railway.
1921 : Company name was changed from the original name Hokutan Keiben Railway to Hokutan Railway.

sen.j: 1923年（大正12年）9月22日 福知山 - 河守間開業
sen.e: September 22, 1923 : Operation of Fukuchiyama - Kawamori section started.
September 22, 1923 : Operation of Fukuchiyama - Kawamori section started.
September 22, 1923 : Operation of Fukuchiyama - Kawamori section started.

sen.j: 1971年（昭和46年）3月2日 福知山 - 河守間休止
sen.e: March 2, 1971 : Operation of Fukuchiyama - Kawamori section was suspended.
March 2, 1971 : Operation of Fukuchiyama - Kawamori section was suspended.
March 2, 1971 : Operation of Fukuchiyama - Kawamori section was suspended.

sen.j: 1974年（昭和49年）2月28日 福知山 - 河守間廃止許可
sen.e: February 28, 1974 : Abolition of Fukuchiyama - Kawamori section was approved.
February 28, 1974 : Abolition of Fukuchiyama - Kawamori section was approved.

sen.j: 全列車各駅停車で全線を6往復している。
sen.e: All trains stopped at each station and made six round trips.
All trains stopped at each station and made six round trips.

sen.j: 運行は2両の気動車が3ヶ月交代でこなし、朝の上り1本と夕方の下り1本はラッシュとなるため客車を1両牽引していた。
sen.e: Two diesel cars ran alternately for three months, and it drew a passenger car during rush hour, an up train in the morning and a down train in the evening.
Two diesel cars ran alternately for three months, and it drew a passenger car during rush hour, an up train in the morning and a down train in the evening.
Two diesel cars ran alternately for three months, and it drew a passenger car during rush hour, an up train in the morning and a down train in the evening.

sen.j: 貨物列車はDB5L2が私有貨車を牽引、小貨物の輸送は気動車がワ1を牽引して行っていた。
sen.e: As for freight service, DB5L2 drew a private freight car and a diesl car drew Wa 1 in the case of small freight,.
As for freight service, DB5L2 pulled a private freight car and a diesl car pulled Wa 1 in the case of small freight,.
As for freight service, DB5L2 pulled a private freight car and a diesel car pulled Wa 1 in the case of small freight.
sen.cmt: dieslをdieselに変更しました。,を除去しました。

sen.j: 福知山駅の管理を福知山西駅の駅員が行っていたこともあり、昼間の間隔の空く時間帯は福知山駅に到着した旅客列車は乗務員、駅員と共に福知山西駅まで回送されて留置されていた。
sen.e: As the staff of the Fukuchiyama-nishi station administered the Fukuchiyama Station, passenger cars arrived at the Fukuchiyama Station during daytime when operation interval was long were forwarded to the Fukuchiyama-nishi station along with train crews/station staff and were kept there.

As the staff of Fukuchiyama-nishi station administered the station, passenger cars arrived at the station during daytime when operation interval was long and were forwarded to the Fukuchiyama-nishi station along with train crews/station staff and were kept there.

As the staff of Fukuchiyama-nishi station administered the station, passenger cars arrived at the station during daytime when operation interval was long and were forwarded to the Fukuchiyama-nishi station along with train crews/station staff and were kept there.

sen.j: 鉄道の合間に同社の路線バスがほぼ並行する路線を5往復運行していた。
sen.e: During the interval of railway service, the company's route buses made five round trips on the road runs parallel to the railway.
During the interval of railway service, the company's route buses made five round trips on the road runs parallel to the railway.
During the interval of railway service, the company's route buses made five round trips on the road runs parallel to the railway.

sen.e: At the time when the operation was suspended
At the time when the operation was suspended
At the time when the operation was suspended

sen.j: 全列車各駅停車。
sen.e: All trains stopped at each station.
All trains stopped at each station.

sen.j: ハフ51は戦時中に鉄道省工場で戦災に合い、ほぼ同じ大きさの客車が代用車として戻っている。
sen.e: Hafu 51 was damaged by war at the factory of Minister of Railway, and a passenger car of similar size was returned in place of it.
